refnamediv.refpurpose: Run MoonUnit unit tests in shared libraries

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: moonunit detects, loads and invokes MoonUnit unit tests in dynamic shared libraries. By default, test results are formatted and printed to the console in real time, but an alternate logging plugin may optionally be specified.

refsect1.title: Options
refsect1.para: moonunit expects one or more shared libraries containing unit tests to be specified as arguments.
In addition, the following options are available:

listitem.para: Runs all tests in suite. This option may be specified multiple times to run tests in multiple suites.
Runs the test named name in suite suite. This option may be specified multiple times to run multiple different tests.
Run all tests in all suites. This is the default behavior if no instances of -s or -t are specified.

Interactively trace failed tests in GDB, the GNU debugger. Each test that fails will immediately be rerun inside a GDB session with a breakpoint set at the line or function nearest to the failure. After leaving the GDB session, moonunit will resume at the next unit test.
Attempts to load and use the logger plugin name. The default logger plugin is "console", which neatly formats and prints test results to stdout.
Sets an option for a particular test component, such as the logger or test runner. These options are largely plugin-specific, although most plugins honor a standard set of common options.
component may be one of "logger" or "runner", with option and value being the option name and value to set on the plugin filling that particular role.
Lists brief usage and option information and exits.
Run all unit tests in library1.so and library2.so, printing results to the console.
Run test bar in the suite Foo in library.so and trace any failures in GDB.
Run all tests in library.so, printing results to the console without ANSI color or fonts codes.
Run all tests in library.so, printing an XML-formatted test summary suitable for postprocessing (e.g. with an XSLT stylesheet) to stdout.
